# Code of Conduct

This project exists to build a solid, respectful, and technically competent community around **Frontline: Blacksite**.

Participation in this repository is a privilege, not a right.

---

## Expected Behavior

All participants are expected to:

* Be respectful and constructive
* Assume good faith in technical discussions
* Keep feedback focused on the work, not the person
* Accept project direction and maintainer decisions gracefully

Disagreement is fine. Hostility is not.

---

## Unacceptable Behavior

The following will not be tolerated:

* Harassment, hate speech, or personal attacks
* Discrimination or exclusion of any kind
* Aggressive, abusive, or intentionally disruptive behavior
* Repeatedly ignoring project guidelines or maintainer requests
* Attempting to exploit, bypass, or pressure for access to restricted systems

This includes behavior in issues, pull requests, discussions, and any other project-related spaces.

---

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies to all project spaces, including:

* GitHub issues and pull requests
* Discussions and reviews
* Community interactions tied to this repository

---

## Enforcement

Maintainers may take any action they deem appropriate, including:

* Comment moderation
* Issue or PR closure
* Temporary or permanent bans from the repository

No warnings are required.

Decisions made by maintainers are final.

---

## Reporting

If you encounter behavior that violates this Code of Conduct, contact the maintainers privately.

Public call-outs or escalation via issues is discouraged.

---

## Final Note

This project prioritizes:

* Technical clarity
* Player safety
* Community trust

Help us keep it that way.
